intro: Hieracium erioleucum subsp. erioleucum, commonly known as the white-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate, often with a fuzzy or hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, with ray florets that are shorter than the central disk florets. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows and along roadsides.
